org.opendaylight.controller.config.api

Interface DependencyResolver

  • All Superinterfaces:
    org.opendaylight.yangtools.concepts.Identifiable<ModuleIdentifier>

    public interface DependencyResolver
extends org.opendaylight.yangtools.concepts.Identifiable<ModuleIdentifier>
    Each new Module can receive resolver from ModuleFactory for looking up dependencies during validation and second phase commit.
    See Also:
    Module

    • Method Detail

      • validateDependency

        void validateDependency(java.lang.Class<? extends AbstractServiceInterface> expectedServiceInterface,
                      javax.management.ObjectName objectName,
                      JmxAttribute jmxAttribute)
        To be used during validation phase to validate serice interface of dependent module.
        Parameters:
        expectedServiceInterface - MBean/MXBean interface which will back the proxy object.
        objectName - ObjectName of dependent module without transaction name (platformON).
        jmxAttribute - for reporting
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when module is not found
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if module does not export this service interface.

      • resolveInstance

        <T> T resolveInstance(java.lang.Class<T> expectedType,
                    javax.management.ObjectName objectName,
                    JmxAttribute jmxAttribute)
        To be used during commit phase to wire actual dependencies.
        Returns:
        dependency instance using Module.getInstance()
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when module is not found

      • resolveIdentity

        <T extends org.opendaylight.yangtools.yang.binding.BaseIdentity> java.lang.Class<? extends T> resolveIdentity(IdentityAttributeRef identityRef,
                                                                                                            java.lang.Class<T> expectedBaseClass)
        To be used during commit phase to resolve identity-ref config attributes.
        Returns:
        actual class object generated from identity

      • validateIdentity

        <T extends org.opendaylight.yangtools.yang.binding.BaseIdentity> void validateIdentity(IdentityAttributeRef identityRef,
                                                                                     java.lang.Class<T> expectedBaseClass,
                                                                                     JmxAttribute jmxAttribute)
        Validate identity-ref config attribute.

      • getAttribute

        java.lang.Object getAttribute(javax.management.ObjectName name,
                            java.lang.String attribute)
                              throws javax.management.MBeanException,
                                     javax.management.AttributeNotFoundException,
                                     javax.management.InstanceNotFoundException,
                                     javax.management.ReflectionException
        Can be used during validation or commit phase to get attribute value of dependent module.
        Parameters:
        name - either direct ObjectName of a Module (type=Module) or service reference (type=ServiceReference) of dependent Module
        attribute - String identifying attribute name in JMX. Note that attributes start with upper case. See JmxAttribute.getAttributeName()
        Throws:
        javax.management.MBeanException
        javax.management.AttributeNotFoundException
        javax.management.InstanceNotFoundException
        javax.management.ReflectionException

      • newMXBeanProxy

        <T> T newMXBeanProxy(javax.management.ObjectName objectName,
                   java.lang.Class<T> interfaceClass)
        Helper method around JMX.newMXBeanProxy(javax.management.MBeanServerConnection, javax.management.ObjectName, Class) }. Returns MXBean proxy for dependent module. Can be used during validation or commit phase to inspect dependent module's attributes.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of proxy for type safe return value
        Parameters:
        objectName - either direct ObjectName of a Module (type=Module) or service reference (type=ServiceReference) of dependent Module
        interfaceClass - MXBean interface to be used as a proxy
        Returns:
        instance of MXBean proxy
